org.kepler.configuration

Class ConfigurationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.configuration.ConfigurationManager

  • public class ConfigurationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to manage configuration options in Kepler. For more information see https://kepler-project.org/developers/teams/framework/kepler-configuration/ proposed-future-kepler-configuration-system and https://kepler-project.org/developers/teams/framework/configuration-system- documentation
    Author:
    Chad Berkley
    Created:
    October 2009

      protected ConfigurationWriter configWriter 
      static java.lang.String dotKeplerConfigurationsDir

      add a property to the manager

      • getInstance

        public static ConfigurationManager getInstance()
        singleton accessor

      • getInstance

        protected static ConfigurationManager getInstance(boolean loadConfiguration)
        singleton accessor. set loadConfiguration to true if you want to load the configuration automatically. This singleton accessor should really only be used for testing.

                                                           java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:

        namespace - namespace within the module
        name - name of the property to get

      • getProperties

        public java.util.List<ConfigurationProperty> getProperties(org.kepler.build.modules.Module module,
                                                           java.lang.String name)
        get a list of properties that belong to a certain module with a specific name. this assumes the default namespace.
        Parameters:
        module -
        name - the name of the property to get

      • getProperty

        public ConfigurationProperty getProperty(org.kepler.build.modules.Module module)
        Returns the root property of the default configuration for a module. This should be stored in a file named "configuration.xml" in the <module>/resources/configurations directory. If no such file exists, this will return null.
        Parameters:
        module - the module to get the default configuration for.

      • getProperty

        public ConfigurationProperty getProperty(org.kepler.build.modules.Module module,
                                         ConfigurationNamespace namespace)
        return the root ConfigurationProperty of the namespace.
        Parameters:
        module - the module to get the property from
        namespace - the namespace to get the property from

      • getProperty

        public ConfigurationProperty getProperty(org.kepler.build.modules.Module module,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        get a property from the module's default namespace configuration with a given name
        Parameters:
        module - the module to get the property from
        name - the name of the property to get.

      • getProperty

        public ConfigurationProperty getProperty(org.kepler.build.modules.Module module,
                                         ConfigurationNamespace namespace,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        return a single property from a module with a specific name in a specific namespace. If more than one property shares a name, the first is returned. Return null if the property is not found.
        Parameters:
        module - the module to get the property from
        namespace - the namespace to get the property from
        name - the name of the property to get

      • saveConfiguration

        public void saveConfiguration()
                       throws ConfigurationManagerException
        serialize the entire configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationManagerException

      • addConfigurationListener

        public void addConfigurationListener(ConfigurationEventListener listener)
        add a configuration listener
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeConfigurationListener

        public void removeConfigurationListener(ConfigurationEventListener listener)
        remove a listener
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • getOverwriteFile

        public static java.io.File getOverwriteFile(org.kepler.build.modules.Module m,
                                            java.io.File f)
        returns the file from the .kepler directory if it exists, returns f if it doesn't. This method should be used to get configuration files because if the file has changed it will be written back to .kepler, not back to the resources/configurations directory of the module.
        Parameters:
        m - the module to get the overwrite file from
        f - the file to get

      • getModule

        public static org.kepler.build.modules.Module getModule(java.lang.String name)
        get a module by name. return null if not found
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the module to get

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners(ConfigurationProperty property)
        notify any listeners that a configuration event has occured
        Parameters:
        property - the property that changed to send to the listeners

      • loadConfiguration

        protected void loadConfiguration()
                          throws ConfigurationManagerException
        deserialize the configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationManagerException

      • clearConfigurations

        protected void clearConfigurations()
        remove all configurations currently listed and reset the configuration manager back to its un-initialized state. This should really only be used for testing.

      • removeFileExtension

        protected static java.lang.String removeFileExtension(java.lang.String filename)
        utility method to remove the file extension from the filename
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename to remove the extension from

      • removeLocaleDesignator

        protected static java.lang.String removeLocaleDesignator(java.lang.String filename)
        remove the locale designator from a filename. this works with or without a file extension (i.e. .xml). This method assumes a locale with both a country and language code (i.e. _en_US).
